decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through removal spells, counterspells, and land destruction. By using cards like Fatal Push, Force of Will, and Wasteland, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from developing a strong board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful artifacts like Urza's Saga and the Moxen accelerates the deck's game plan, allowing it to quickly establish control and close out the game efficiently. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck gains additional value by recurring key spells and permanents.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday with Thassa's Oracle to win the game quickly and efficiently. It utilizes powerful blue spells like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall to protect the combo and dig through the deck with efficient cantrips like Ponder and Preordain. The deck also includes powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find key pieces of the combo quickly. Overall, the deck is designed to be a fast and consistent combo deck that can win the game in just a few turns.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. It also includes powerful card draw and tutoring effects to ensure consistency and adaptation to different matchups. The inclusion of Lurrus as a companion adds additional value by providing a recurring threat or source of card advantage. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells and enable a mix of aggressive and reactive gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue opponents in a fast-paced, interactive format.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Luminarch Aspirant and Stoneforge Mystic fetching equipment like Batterskull and Kaldra Compleat. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Force of Vigor and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing mana acceleration from Moxen and Noble Hierarch. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and disruption, with utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to further disrupt opponents' plans.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro - Fish deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Questing Druid to quickly pressure the opponent. By combining disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with card advantage engines like Expressive Iteration and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to control the game while applying consistent pressure. The inclusion of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk further solidifies the deck's ability to outpace and outmaneuver opponents, allowing for quick victories through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on using fast ramp and disruptive artifacts to quickly assemble a board presence and control the game. Mishra's Workshop allows for explosive starts, while Golos, Tireless Pilgrim acts as a versatile threat and tool box. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland target the opponent's mana base, while Sphere of Resistance and Null Rod hinder their spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Lodestone Golem, locking them out of the game with cards like Trinisphere and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale.

The deck aims to control the game through the powerful enchantment Oath of Druids, which allows the player to cheat out big creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck runs disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and can also win through alternate avenues like Show and Tell and Flash. The deck uses a mix of acceleration in the form of Moxen and tutors like Demonic Tutor to consistently execute its game plan. With cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Veil of Summer for protection, the deck looks to dominate the game through powerful creatures and efficient disruption.

The main idea of this Vintage Combo-Dredge deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Ichorid, then bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba using mechanics like Dredge and Hollow One. Utilize Bazaar of Baghdad to dig for combo pieces and disrupt opponents with cards like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy. Noxious Revival and Creeping Chill provide additional graveyard and life gain utility, while Bridge from Below can generate token creatures from your graveyard. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient graveyard-oriented strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland. It also includes card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to stay ahead in resources. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, maintain control of the board, and ultimately outvalue and outlast them to secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and building a strong board presence. Utilizing powerful control spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, along with disruptive cards like Wasteland and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With key cards like Lrien Revealed and Urza's Saga, the deck also has the potential to generate extra resources and create a threatening board state. Ultimately, this deck aims to outplay and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The main focus of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with key cards and use cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Golgari Thug to enable powerful graveyard recursion. This allows you to bring back creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam for free, quickly overwhelming your opponent with a swarm of creatures. By utilizing cards like Grief and Cabal Therapy to disrupt your opponent's game plan and protect your own combo pieces with Force of Will and Force of Negation, you can quickly take control of the game and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly using cards like Ancient Tomb, Mishra's Workshop, and Sol Ring to power out powerful artifacts such as Mana Vault and Moxen. The key strategy is to use Paradoxical Outcome to bounce these artifacts back to hand, drawing cards and generating mana in the process. Cards like Grim Monolith and Manifold Key help to generate additional mana and untap artifacts for more explosive plays. The deck also includes cards like Tinker and Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for game-winning artifacts like Time Vault.

This deck is focused on quickly assembling the combo pieces needed, usually starting with a Doomsday spell followed by using Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It utilizes a combination of card draw, manipulation, and protection spells to set up the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. The inclusion of several tutors and cantrips allows the player to find the necessary pieces with relative ease, while also having access to disruption cards to protect the combo from being interrupted. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn, often catching opponents off guard.

The deck is centered around creating a powerful mana base with Mishra's Workshop and ramping up quickly with artifacts like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Ancient Tomb. It also utilizes cards like Nettlecyst and Patchwork Automaton to quickly apply pressure on the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Null Rod. The inclusion of cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland allows for resource denial, while Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge provide additional versatility and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, disruption, and resilience.

This Vintage Oath of Druids control deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using Oath of Druids to cheat them into play. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to control the game, as well as versatile cards like Show and Tell and Tinker to set up game-winning plays. The deck's mana base is tuned for consistency and includes key cards like Black Lotus and the Moxen for acceleration. The goal is to quickly establish a dominant board presence and control the game from there.
